sentences.sContent: I wasn’t sure if I’d got quite enough petrol to get me home, but I decided to chance it .
sentences.sCn: 我不知道开车回家汽油够不够，但我决定冒险一试。

sentences.sContent: We decided not to chance our luck in the storm.
sentences.sCn: 我们决定不去冒险顶着暴风雨出去。

sentences.sContent: She’d never played before, but she was ready to chance her arm (= take a risk by doing something which may fail ) .
sentences.sCn: 她以前从未玩过，但她准备冒险试一下。

synos.tran: 机会，际遇；运气，侥幸；可能性

phrases.pCn: 不容易有的机会；极小的可能性
极小的可能性，不大可能的机会
机会对策；靠技巧取胜的游戏
经过努力奋斗才能获得成功的机会
极有限的一点机会[常用于否定句]

words.tran: 不确实的；偶然发生的；不安的

trans.tranCn: 碰巧， 偶然发生； 冒…的险
trans.tranOther: to do something that you know involves a risk

trans.tranCn: 机会；可能性，偶然性；偶然的事
trans.tranOther: the possibility that something will happen, especially something you want
